69% of respondents believe that companies are vulnerable to hacks and frankly considering the headlines we see

insights to this the first is when it comes to the speed of coming up with privacy infrastructures businesses are

but the second thing is we don't have a choice when it comes to dealing with government you can stop using certain

to be about but the second number is my real favorite one the 88% number 88
percent of respondents said that they will willingly give us their data if they trust us and if they know how their

here even in the lack of trust so what do we learn from all of this three
things first privacy is an all-hands-on-deck do not just let the legal team of the company think that

is Tier one and of course as you move up and down the tiers that risk decreases and the pressure to protect it also goes
